etymology: From Middle English lovely, luvelich, lufli, from Old English luflīc (“amiable, loving, lovable”), equivalent to love +‎ -ly.

text: Beautiful; charming; very pleasing in form, looks, tone, or manner.
examples: It's a lovely day and the sun is shining.
The music box plays a lovely melody.
The castle garden enchants visitors with its lovely blooms.
Not one so fair of face, of speech so lovely.
Then I look at you / And the world's alright with me / Just one look at you / And I know it's gonna be / A lovely day
It would be lovely to have a little more money to spend.
It is a lovely night, and why should we not prolong our ride a little?"
a most lovely gentlemanlike man
Many a lovely look on them he cast.
seal the title with a lovely kiss

text: lovely (comparative more lovely, superlative most lovely)
(informal) In a lovely fashion or manner; beautifully.
examples: She's not everyone's cup of tea, what with the way she speaks her mind and doesn't always do her hair in the morning, but she scrubs up lovely.

text: (informal) An attractive, lovely person, especially a (professional) beauty.
examples: Synonyms: pretty, darling
a calendar depicting young lovelies in bikinis
Goodbye, my lovely.
But where do you go to my lovely / When you're alone in your bed?

In Montréal, the summer months bring in a huge variety of fruits and vegetables and this is the time to preserve them. Preserving can also refer to the storage of these fiber and vitamin rich lovelies.

etymology: From Middle English lovely, loveli, lofli, lovelike, lovelic (“praiseworthy; laudatory”), equivalent to lofe +‎ -ly. Cognate with Dutch loffelijk (“laudable, praiseworthy”), German löblich (“commendable, laudable, praiseworthy”), Swedish lovlig (“permissible”). More at lofe, love.

text: lovely (comparative lovelier or more lovely, superlative loveliest or most lovely)
examples: And so he is in the eyes of all who live to his praise. To them every attribute of God is lovely. The holiness and purity of his nature is most lovely to them.
He is altogether lovely. O, all our praises of him are poor and low things!
